intro: Allium veratrifolium, commonly known as the death camas, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges. It is important to note that all parts of this plant are toxic and should not be ingested.
